description: As upper right triangle, number of strongly unimodal partitions of n (strongly unimodal means strictly increasing then strictly decreasing) where initial part is k.
links: R. C. Rhoades, Strongly Unimodal Sequences and Mixed Mock Modular Forms
formula: T(n, k)=S(n, k)+sum_j[T(n-k, j)] for j>k, where S(n, k)=A059607(n, k)=sum_j[S(n-k, j)] for k>j [note reversal] with S(0, 0)=1.
mathematica: s[n_?Positive, k_] := s[n, k] = Sum[s[n-k, j], {j, 0, k-1}]; s[0, 0] = 1; s[0, _] = 0; s[_?Negative, _] = 0; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = s[n, k] + Sum[t[n-k, j], {j, k+1, n}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 13}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Sep 11 2012 *)
crossrefs: Top row is A059618 and is sum of other rows (for n>0). Cf. A000009, A000041, A001523, A059607.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jan 31 2001
